keywords.cdata: boreholes, capacity building, construction, Irrigation, Project Management, public toilets, RURAL WATER, RURAL WATER SUPPLY, SANITATION, sanitation facilities, service contracts, surface water, Water Resources, water storage

project_abstract.cdata: The objective of the Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Project for Sudan is to increase access to safe water and sanitation facilities in all states throughout Southern Sudan and to build capacity for sustainable management, regulation and expansion of the rural water and sanitation sector. The closing date for the project will be extended from March 31, 2011 until June 30, 2011. The extension is necessary to allow ongoing works and service contracts to come to successful closure. Doing this will enable the project to meet its set development objectives. The implementing agency, the Ministry of Water Resources and Irrigation of the Government of Southern Sudan (MWRI) has submitted in writing its request on February 14, 2011, and has prepared an updated procurement plan. MWRI made a formal request to extend the project closing date from March 31, 2011 to September 30, 2011. However, since the overall closing date of the Multi Donor Trust Fund - Southern Sudan (MDTF-S) is up to June 30, 2011 and anticipating an additional three months to be sufficient to complete the remaining activities, only a three month extension request up to June 30, 2011 is proposed. This will be the second extension of the project.
